rename.from: Bug: no-restricted-imports only show an error only on last element when using an array of different importNames and same name
rename.to: Bug: no-restricted-imports shows an error only on last element when using an array of different importNames and same name

body: The problem is that you have multiple paths objects with the same name. Only the last “react-native” path is being checked because of that. The path objects are intended to have unique names.
@mdjermanovic you have a better handle of what this rule is supposed to do. Is this the intended behavior? (It appears so from the code.)
The use case of a custom message for each named import seems valuable; if it was meant to be unique names, I’d expect it to have been an object with paths as keys instead of an array.

The rule expects unique `name` in `paths`. It is intended behavior. If there are multiple restricted named exports from same module, configuration should contain a single entry for that module, with all restricted names in `importNames`.

```js
{
    name: 'react-native',
    importNames: ['Text', 'TextInput' /*, .... */],
    message: 'import Text from ui/_components instead. import TextInput from ui/_components instead ...'
}
```
Should perhaps the rule error out eagerly then, when the config contains duplicate names?

> Should perhaps the rule error out eagerly then, when the config contains duplicate names?

I think it should, as that seems better than silently overwriting previous entries.

However, there is a technical problem - JSON Schema doesn't support defining such constraints.

True - which is why an object with keys would have been a better schema, because it’s impossible to violate the constraint. It’d be fine now tho (altho potentially breaking / arguably patch) to throw a runtime error from the rule itself.

> throw a runtime error from the rule itself

We try to avoid that contents of the files being linted can break linting.

Invalid configuration in a `/* eslint some-rule: ["error", ...] */` directive comment normally only produces a lint error ([demo example](https://eslint.org/demo#eyJ0ZXh0IjoiLyogZXNsaW50IG5vLXJlc3RyaWN0ZWQtaW1wb3J0czogW1wiZXJyb3JcIiwgMTIzNDVdICovXG5cbmZvbzsiLCJvcHRpb25zIjp7InBhcnNlck9wdGlvbnMiOnsiZWNtYVZlcnNpb24iOiJsYXRlc3QiLCJzb3VyY2VUeXBlIjoibW9kdWxlIiwiZWNtYUZlYXR1cmVzIjp7fX0sInJ1bGVzIjp7Im5vLXVuZGVmIjoyfSwiZW52Ijp7fX19)). Throwing an error would break the whole process.

Ah, interesting, I wasn't aware of that. That's not a constraint I believe I've followed in the eslint plugins i maintain - it seems like that's not a useful constraint if eslint isn't enforcing it (by converting runtime errors from parsing config comments to lint errors), and if it did so, then wouldn't eslint core rules be able to throw those runtime errors?

FYI: the test that ensures errors thrown in rules are bubbled up:

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/04e91b615743cbb25cd9103e7329b056bd1572ad/tests/lib/linter/linter.js#L79

We can’t really convert thrown errors into linting errors because we don’t have any location information to associate with it (because the error isn’t in the file being linted but rather in the rule source).

On the other hand, it seems feasible to merge multiple path objects with the same name into one before running the rule. I’d argue that behavior is more expected than the current one.

> On the other hand, it seems feasible to merge multiple path objects with the same name into one before running the rule. I’d argue that behavior is more expected than the current one.

@eslint/eslint-tsc what do folks think about this?

When you say merge multiple path objects, do you imagine it would take the union of all `importNames` and use just the last error message? From a quick skim of the source, it doesn't look too terribly impossible to key on `Tuple<name, importNames>` instead of just `name` so that each `importName` could have a distinct message as expected in the original report.

I was thinking we can allow multiple objects with the same “path” and treat importNames and message as a tuple under the “path”, so the messages still match up correctly. I’d argue that is the expected behavior.

> I was thinking we can allow multiple objects with the same “path” and treat importNames and message as a tuple under the “path”, so the messages still match up correctly.

I think this is doable. There are some details to discuss (for example, what should be the message for `import *`), but I believe we could sort it out.

This, however, looks like a breaking change, because now-unused config entries will become used and can produce new lint errors, so it might be better to plan it for ESLint v9.0.0?

> I’d argue that is the expected behavior.

Agreed, cool.

> This, however, looks like a breaking change, because now-unused config entries will become used and can produce new lint errors, so it might be better to plan it for ESLint v9.0.0?

You’re right, it would be. And it wouldn’t be a semver-minor bug fix because this wasn’t the intended behavior originally (just plausibly expectable).
Marking as breaking and added to the v9 board for us to review.

issue.title: fix: allow multiple custom messages for `no-restricted-imports`

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[x] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:


<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)
Before, if you provided multiple custom messages for different import paths in `no-restricted-imports`, the rule would only check for the last set of import paths. This PR fixes it so that the custom error will be thrown for all import paths. It adds a test that is broken before my change but passing after this change.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?
It's a pretty simple fix (looping through an array) so hopefully not too tricky to review.
<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
